# backButtonAppearance

**Instance Property**

The appearance attributes for the back button.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying @MainActor var backButtonAppearance: UIBarButtonItemAppearance { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you don’t change the value of this property, the navigation bar applies the attributes from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationBarAppearance/buttonAppearance] property.

## Configuring the Back button

- **backIndicatorImage**: The image to display on the leading edge of the back button.
- **backIndicatorTransitionMaskImage**: The image for masking content flowing under the back indicator image during push and pop transitions.
- **setBackIndicatorImage(_:transitionMaskImage:)**: Sets the back button indicator image and its transition mask.
